info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:44PM EDT until June 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLAY...WESTERN CALHOUN AND NORTHEASTERN EARLY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 144 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles west of Arlington, or 8 miles northeast of Blakely, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Edison around 155 PM EDT. Arlington around 200 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Colomokee, Commissary Hill, Turman, Parksville, Ferrell Crossroads, Bluffton, Kolomoki Mounds Sp and Dickey. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
